source.ccbaa33a:
import rx 
from rx import of,operators as op
from rx.subject import BehaviorSubject
source.43aaecac:
behavior_subject = BehaviorSubject(DATA1);
behavior_subject.subscribe(
   lambda x: print("Subscriber Kim: {0}".format(x))
)
print("publish data2")
behavior_subject.on_next(DATA2)
print("")

behavior_subject.subscribe(
   lambda x: print("Subscriber Lee : {0}".format(x))
)

print("publish data3")
behavior_subject.on_next(DATA3)
print("")

source.ec6f4290:
behavior_subject = BehaviorSubject(DATA1);
behavior_subject.subscribe(
   lambda x: print("Subscriber Kim: {0}".format(x))
)
print("publish data1")
behavior_subject.on_next(DATA2)
behavior_subject.on_next(DATA3)
print("")

behavior_subject.subscribe(
   lambda x: print("Subscriber Lee : {0}".format(x))
)

print("publish data2")
behavior_subject.on_next(DATA4)
print("")
source.3dfbc2c5:
### subject (observable + observer)

A subject is an observable sequence, as well as, an observer.
source.cfccbad8:
BehaviorSubject will give you 

### the latest value when called. 

You can create behavior subject

BehaviorSubject(init value);
